data.title: Great for quick drinks and bites
data.text: We were staying at the Captain Cook and came by here after work for drinks. They had a good selection of wines and beers + some great apps that we munched on as opposed to a formal dinner. The service was very friendly and prompt.

data.title: Interesting Spot
data.text: Not sure I like the whole self-serve wine by the glass bit, but I loved the smooth jazz and the urban vibe.

data.title: Night Cap
data.text:
Visited twice during our stay at Captain Cook Hotel. There is a security at the entrance checking ID.
We ate at the bar and pretty much stayed there enjoying a delicious array of concoctions - blueberry basil, blood orange and lemon drop. Husband stuck with his vodka soda water. The staff are super friendly and attentive. 
The deep fried olives are awesome and the oysters are delicious.

data.title: Best Sweet Potato Fries Ever
data.text: Oh what fun using the wine dispensers at Whales Tail! Brandon was our waiter, and did a fantastic job explaining how it works. We enjoyed the food, the atmosphere, the music, the service, and I especially liked the Chocolate Block wine. Thank you Brandon, for making our final evening in Alaska another wonderful memory.

data.title: Great food
data.text: Food was really great.  They have a "self serve" wine station.  There were 10 of us and they took us right in with no problem.

data.title: Quick Bites
data.text: This was a great spot to pick up a quick meal. They have an extensive list of small plates from fish tacos to sliders and oysters. Their blackberry martini was fantastic.

data.title: Appetizers supreme
data.text: Bacon wrapped dates, Amish pretzels, burgers.  We tried them all on our recent stay at the Captain Cook.  Food was fantastic.  Server was fun to visit with as he had driven himself to AK a year ago.  Both servers worked hard during the rush we were in on a Thursday night.  No problems, no complaints, just great food in a pleasant setting with superb service.

data.title: Nice lounge with good food
data.text: Relaxing lounge with very wide wine selection.  Good bar food selections with good service and a friendly staff.

data.title: Good place for drinks
data.text: We went to Whale's tale after we had finished dinner in downtown. We went here around 8:30 PM and we spent about 3-4 hours here. It is a nice little bar. We had wine, Moscow mules, shots and ordered some appetizers as well. It was a great fun experience - they also had trivia night going on.

data.title: Great food and wine
data.text: We stopped in for appetizers and wine sampling, and had a fantastic time with both. I think we ordered all of the appetizers, and we enjoyed them all! The wine selection is nice, there's something for everyone, at a few different price points - it's nice to try a sip of expensive wine without having to buy the bottle! Great place to gather after work or on the weekends with a group of friends.

data.title: Good Food - Expensive
data.text: Everything is expensive in Alaska - we were told it was because everything has to be brought in. The service, quantity and quality we all very good....US$65:00 for Wings & Fries + 2 drinks...is expensive to us Brits...

data.title: Good place for wine and apps
data.text:
We went based on a review. The wine dispenser was an interesting concept since we'd never seen it before. You could take 2.5 oz, 4 oz, or 6 oz  for reasonable prices. Better be a red wine lover though. I believe they had 24 reds and 7 wines, most of which were on the sweeter side. 
They had many varieties of small plates and a few large plates if you were so inclined. We shared some small plates which was enough for dinner since we'd been eating out for the last 10 days. Service was good. Liked the atmosphere. One of our party said he wouldn't go back and wasn't impressed with the dispensers but 1 out of 4 isn't bad.

data.title: Happy Hour!!
data.text: We found half-price appetizers and drinks that were plenty for us...and delicious.  An interesting way to taste a number of wines was available with a wine card and a wine dispensing machine. Pub atmosphere and good food -- just right for us after a long day of travel and walking the trail and shopping area.

data.title: Good Trivia Night Out With Friends
data.text: My wife and I met up with 5 others for trivia night. There is a grand prize as well as raffle prizes all throughout the night. We had the shrimp appetizer as well as the sliders. The sliders tasted great but the Hawaiian sweet roll was a little soggy. The shrimps were breaded with the shells on so they're a little frustrating to eat while playing trivia. We will definitely try to do another trivia night here before the summer is over.

data.title: dinner at the Whales Tail
data.text: The service was excellent and the shrimp was a delicious value.  We enjoyed it so much the first evening that we returned the next night for another serving

data.title: Wine bar
data.text: This is a interesting place as they have all kinds of wine and you can pour a glass yourself.  You prepay for  a card and then you choose your wine.

data.title: Good place for a Drink
data.text: Had the Kobe Beef sliders here and they were wonderful.  Service was good, and had a nice selection of local beers.

data.title: Upscale Bar
data.text: The best part of this bar is the wine vending machines!  Fun with wine.  You buy a wine card (value of your choosing), then use the card to pay for the wine you order from the vending machine.  Various serving sizes are available, so that you can try several varieties.

data.title: Girls Night Fun!
data.text: After hearing great things about Whales Tail, a few of us girls got together for a little relaxation. A few of us were first timers, so we had to get an explanation of how the self service wine bar operates.  Our server did a great job of this. It was super easy by the way, once you get the hang of it. The wine selection was great and the appetizers were equally as good. Lots of variety to accommodate anyone's palette. I will definitely be returning, can't wait to bring my husband next!

data.title: Excellent atmosphere, food and service in a unique bistro!
data.text:
My husband and I enjoyed a wonderful dinner with wine and beer tastings in this bistro! After a day of travel, we arrived at the Captain Cook Hotel and wanted to try this unique wine bistro where wines were available in a self service style and the food was well rated. The bar area was relaxing and unique, with stained glass whale murals, whales tails taps and wine selections around the room. I enjoyed trying some different wines and my husband enjoyed a flight of local beers. The artichoke dip appetizer with pizza points was delicious, as were the halibut fish and chips which included sweet potato and regular fries. Our waiter was very nice and took great care of us. I mistakenly left the card you have to purchase to use the self service wine inserted at a wine station but when I checked at the bar to see if someone turned it in they had it waiting for me. 
We thoroughly enjoyed the Whales Tail Bistro and highly recommend it!!
